Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mothy \Moth"y\, a. Infested with moths; moth-eaten. ``An old mothy saddle.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]
mothy adj 1: worn or eaten away by (or as if by) moths; "moth-eaten blankets" [syn: {moth-eaten}] 2: infested with moths [also: {mothiest}, {mothier}]
